For this workshop, and if you are following the view from Noel (2024) this requires you to install postgres to use it on your terminal. Found this steps (commands) to get it done [source]:
wget --quiet -O - https://www.postgresql.org/media/keys/ACCC4CF8.asc | sudo apt-key add -
sudo sh -c 'echo "deb http://apt.postgresql.org/pub/repos/apt/ $(lsb_release -cs)-pgdg main" >> /etc/apt/sources.list.d/pgdg.list'
sudo apt update
apt install postgresql postgresql-contrib
(comment): now let’s check the service for postgresql
service postgresql status
(comment) If down: use the next command
service postgresql start
(comment) And your are done
question: How to install postgress on Linux like OS
